name: Granada
fun_fact: Fun fact: Granada is Spain's last free tapas capital - every drink you order comes with a complimentary tapa, and the quality and size improve the more you drink, creating a unique bar-hopping culture where locals strategically order drinks to maximize their free food, making Granada the ultimate budget foodie destination.

hero_dishes.name: Morcilla (Black Pudding) at La Tana
hero_dishes.description: Spanish blood sausage spread on soft bread and sprinkled with pine nuts. Rich, savory, unforgettable.
hero_dishes.origin_story: La Tana was featured on Anthony Bourdain's 'Parts Unknown' Granada episode for this dish. Their morcilla preparation showcases Andalusian mastery of charcuterie, transforming blood sausage into something elegant and memorable.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: La Tana (featured on Parts Unknown with Anthony Bourdain)

hero_dishes.name: Croquetas at Los Manueles
hero_dishes.description: Giant, creamy croquettes - the best (and biggest) in town, with crispy coating and molten b√©chamel interior.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Los Manueles has delighted customers since 1917 in Granada's historic center. Their oversized croquettes became legendary, setting the standard for what croquetas should be - creamy, crispy, generous.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Los Manueles (iconic bar since 1917, Granada historic center)

hero_dishes.name: Pionono
hero_dishes.description: Granada's signature pastry - delicate sponge cake soaked in milk and spices, wrapped around sweet custard.
hero_dishes.origin_story: With origins in Al-Andalus (Moorish Spain), pionono represents Granada's unique cultural heritage. The recipe survived centuries, becoming Granada's most beloved dessert that connects modern Spain to its Moorish past.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional pastry shops throughout Granada, cafes in the historic center

signature_drinks.name: Vermouth with Olives
signature_drinks.description: Spanish vermouth served with Granada's famous olives, often skewered with other ingredients.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Enjoyed during merienda (5:30-7:30 PM) at La Picater√≠a and other bars. The ritual of vermouth and olives is quintessentially Granada - relaxed, social, affordable.

signature_drinks.name: Local Granada Beer
signature_drinks.description: Locally brewed beers paired with the free tapas tradition.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ordered strategically during tapas crawls. Locals know which bars give the best tapas with each drink order. The more you drink, the better the tapas - creating a unique drinking culture.
